arts.ttl: Mark Robins wants to change narrative as relegation scrap heads into final five
arts.sum: Stoke came into this on the back of encouraging performances against QPR and Preston but there was no doubt that this was a big, potentially pivotal match, and the nerves seemed to infect everyone in the stadium. Stoke City were left kicking themselves after letting a lead slip in injury time to draw with relegation rivals Luton Town.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins' 'couldn't believe it' verdict as Stoke City let vital points slip vs Luton
arts.sum: Stoke were up to 17th in the as-it-stands table - and seven points clear of Luton - when the board went up at the bet365 Stadium to show there would be five minutes of added time, leading 1-0 thanks to Lewis Baker's deflected free-kick. "Really disappointed but, emotions out of it, we've got to take that point and make it into a better one on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Alli scores in stoppage time to snatch Luton a vital point at Stoke
Millenic Alli rescues much-needed late Luton point in draw at Stoke
arts.sum: Lewis Baker’s free-kick put the hosts on course for three points but Hatters substitute Alli levelled at the death.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Luton as curse strikes again and scrap deepens
arts.sum: Lewis Baker had given Stoke the lead in the 74th minute when his free-kick was deflected into the net and Stoke were forced deeper and deeper, with a little bit of panic, as they tried to hold onto what would have been a vital win. Referee Dean Whitestone gave Stoke the free-kick after being alerted by his assistant – and Stoke fans were not impressed when he booked Junior Tchamadeu, for dissent, rather than show a second yellow to the forward.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Luton as Mark Robins keeps faith
arts.sum: Stoke: Johansson, Tchamadeu, Bocat, Wilmot, Phillips, Thompson, Burger, Baker, Manhoef, Junho, Gallagher. It means Sam Gallagher leads the line, flanked by Bae Junho and Million Manhoef while Jordan Thompson is joined by Wouter Burger and Lewis Baker in midfield.

arts.ttl: Stoke City vs Luton Town live - Team news from bet365 Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: Sam Gallagher was an eye-catching signing in the club's recruitment drive last summer, but only now does the forward himself feel as though he has the desired fitness levels on his side after months of injury frustration. Especially coming into a new team at the start of the season and I was watching training through the windows of the gym, when I could've been out there getting to know everyone - it's maybe taken me a little longer to build up those relationships.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers, Stoke City keen on 19-year-old as Nottingham Forest exit awaits
arts.sum: Blackburn Rovers, Stoke City and Norwich City are keen on Adam Berry as he prepares to leave Nottingham… The post Blackburn Rovers, Stoke City keen on 19-year-old as Nottingham Forest exit awaits appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Town skipper relieved Luton are showing signs of life after a 'mental season'
arts.sum: Morris looking to keep momentum going at Stoke City this evening

arts.ttl: Liam Delap reflects on Stoke City lesson as Man Utd, Chelsea and Newcastle eye £50m transfer
arts.sum: The son of Stoke legend Rory Delap was on loan at the bet365 Stadium for the first-half of the 2022/23 season, but when things did not go to plan he was recalled by Manchester City and sent to Preston instead, where he teamed up with one Tom Cannon. The 21-year-old then spent time at Hull City before being snapped up in a £20m deal by Ipswich Town last summer - and has since gone on to bag 12 top-flight goals in 30 appearances for the Tractor Boys - the latest against Wolves last weekend.
